All kidding aside, if you are trying to be politically correct, just stick with "deaf" or "hard-of-hearing."  The term "hearing impaired" is outdated, like "deaf mute" or "deaf & dumb".

1920x800? Why dont you make 1920x1080 instead. I was thinking that your LED/LCD TV is 1920x800 only.. :-D

@P4ssw0rd

Because that's the way it was filmed. :/

The most common aspect ratios used in films are 1.85:1 and 2.39:1 @ 24fps, so, 1.85:1 at 24fps(in this case 48fps) is as close to the original source as you can get.

So, if you have 16:9 you would lose some of the picture. Or it would have to be up-scaled.

For the average middle age balding man, YIFY movies that are 720p resolution yet DVD quality these would be fine...

For the rest of us who want quality and DTS surround....this is not up to my standards

I'm sorry, usually YIFY does okay quality for the file size... but calling this 1080p is a flat-out lie. By definition it must be 1920x1080 but this is 1920x800. 

I really wish there was a true 1080p section on TPB for people who value quality over small files, as the Top 100 'Hi-Res Movies' has been totally diluted with YIFY files, many of which are even sub-720p. 

I don't blame YIFY, I blame the uneducated users that simply see that it's in the HD Movie section or see that it's under 2GB and say to themselves "Wow, so small! I can fit loads of these on my iPad" and think that's good enough, not even knowing what a bitrate is. 

These things are going to look a little better than a DVD rip but they are definitely NOT "Full HD". 

If you're going to pirate movies you might as well do it properly and get something that looks GOOD. 

These YIFY videos are great those of you not living in a first world country who might have bandwidth caps or slow internet, however.

Also, it boggles my mind to see people rating

You know both sides have a point in this debate. This is not 1080p, not even close to being the same quality of the blu-ray disc that you would buy. 

The lack of surround sound doesn't really bother me but I find my self having to turn the volume up to max for YIFY movies.

Lastly, I'm not looking for true 1080p, it's file size would be too big and for me personaly, it's just not worth my time to download that and copy it to my PS3. I need to copy using PS3 media server because I use subtitles which triples the file size, so I would be copying a file thats like 60gb which would take all day.

With that said, for what I'm looking for, this is perfect which is why I would give it a 10/10. However, it should not be titled as 1080p because it's not even close.
